Modals

Required files

SCSS files required: _components.modal.scss

JS files required: modal.js

The markup

The button to trigger the modal should have the attribute to initiate the javascript data-js-module="modal" plus an attribute to target the modal ID data-modal="testModal"

The modal itself needs an ID and the following classes .modal, .hidden, .fade-in

Inside the modal should be an element with the class .modal__content

Inside the modal content element should be the close button with a class .modal__close and optional styling. (In the below examples various classes are applied to create a spinning cross icon in a circle)

There is also the option to add an element following the button with the class .modal__panel. This is useful if you want a different background colour or a border

Note: To customise the panel you can apply various global helper classes such as .bg-white and b-radius and on the .modal__content element you might want to apply a max width class.
